textPlain: I just love how this language marches forward. I have so many colleagues that hate many aspects of it but I sit here combining Go, Goa and SQLc writing mountains of code and having a fairly good compiler behind me. I understand what I’m missing out on by not using stricter languages and so often it’s a totally fine trade off.
Yay new version! Not the most exciting (as Go releases tend to be which is good), but hopefully jsonv2 and greentea can get some testing and be standard in 1.26

I did not like it at first but it has grown on me. I still have my gripes, which are mostly things that come from its overall architecture and will never be resolved, but it is pretty enjoyable to use for the limited domain I use it in at work.
> greenteaI didn't know what it is and had to look it up. Looks like a new GC.https://github.com/golang/go/issues/73581
